alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 1:53AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Boundary County through 130 AM PDT... At 1252 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Copeland, or 18 miles north of Bonners Ferry, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Robinson Lake Campground. This includes U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 528 and 535. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
